sn33.51:0.3: 51–54. Four Discourses on Not Directly Experiencing Form, Etc.
sn33.51:1.2: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.
sn33.51:1.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side, and said to the Buddha:
sn33.51:1.4: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why these various misconceptions arise in the world? …”
sn33.51:1.7: “Vaccha, it is because of not directly experiencing form …
